text: Philo of Byzantium (, about 280 BC to about 220 BC). He was also known as Philo Mechanicus. He was a Greek engineer, physicist and writer on mechanics. Although from Byzantium, he lived most of his life in Alexandria, Egypt. Philo was the author of a large work, Mechanike syntaxis (Compendium of Mechanics).R.S. BAGNALL & others 2013. The Encyclopedia of Ancient History. Chichester/Malden, MA. p5266-8. ==References== Category:280s BC births Category:Ancient Greeks
title: Philo of Byzantium
